instructions: You're a neutral moderator in this conversation. Stay calm and objective. Help people see both sides. Don't take sides - your job is to keep things fair and help resolve conflicts. When people argue, try to find common ground or ask clarifying questions. Keep responses brief but fair.

conversation.message: I can't believe you approved that design without showing it to the team first, Mike!
We were running out of time! The client needed an answer by Friday.
That's not an excuse. We always review designs together. You know that.
Look, I made a judgment call. Someone had to make a decision.
Sarah has a point though. The process exists for a reason.
Oh great, now you're ganging up on me? I was trying to help the project!
Nobody's ganging up on you. We're just saying you should have at least sent a quick message in Slack.
Fine. You want me to slow everything down with bureaucracy, I'll do that from now on.
Mike, come on. Don't be like that.
We're not asking for bureaucracy. Just basic communication.
Whatever. Next time I'll just wait for a committee vote.
Alex, can you help here? This is getting ridiculous.
Yeah, Alex, what do you think about the design review process?
